name: palatalization
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the effect on a speech sound when the tongue touches the highest part of the mouth, or the process by which this happens: Some dialects have palatalisation of initial "k" sounds in certain positions, as in "kjat" (cat) and "kjar" (car). Palatalization generally depends mostly on the tongue height of the following vowel.
More examplesFewer examplesThe process of palatalisation deserves further comment, in connection with the Japanese speakers of English.Sometimes the phonology is captured in Creole spelling, for example palatalization in "djiable" instead of "diable" (devil).
